title: 109_s1797
content: The Act titled "Foreign Investment Security Act of 2005" is established. Congressional authority under the Defense Production Act is outlined. Section 721 of the Defense Production Act of 1950 is amended to extend the timeframe for investigations and require findings to be sent to the President and specific congressional committees for review. Additionally, the chairman and ranking member of the Senate and House committees can request investigations. Section 721 of the Defense Production Act of 1950 is amended to extend the timeframe for investigations from 30 to 60 days. Findings and recommendations of investigations must be sent to the President, the Senate Committee on Banking, Housing, and Urban Affairs, and the House Committee on Financial Services for review. Additionally, changes are made to the language regarding the authority of designees in subsection (f).
